alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 2:26PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY... Northeast winds sustained 20 to 35 mph, with gusts up to 45 mph, will return Friday afternoon and continue through the overnight hours before slowly diminishing Saturday. These winds are then expected to increase again late Saturday evening and continue through Sunday before diminishing by Monday morning. Loose debris may still be affected by these winds and should be secured where possible. Wind chills from 10 to 25 below zero are expected with higher winds. This could cause dangerous life-threatening conditions for those without power, as frostbite can develop in as little as as 15 minutes in these conditions. For the latest information, visit us at: weather.gov/anchorage.
